com.percussion.extension
Class PSExtensionRef

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.extension.PSExtensionRef
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class PSExtensionRef
extends Object
implements Serializable

A simple, immutable class used to refer uniquely to an extension by its handler name, context within the handler, and the extension name itself.

See Also:
Serialized Form

PSExtensionRef

public PSExtensionRef(String handlerName,
                      String context,
                      String extensionName)
Constructs a new, immutable extension reference that refers uniquely to the given extension name.

Parameters:
handlerName - The handler name. Must not be null and must be a valid handler name.
context - The context. Must not be null and must be a valid context.
extensionName - The extension name. Must not be null and must be a valid extension name.
See Also:
isValidExtensionName(java.lang.String), isValidContext(java.lang.String)

PSExtensionRef

public PSExtensionRef(String category,
                      String handlerName,
                      String context,
                      String extensionName)
Constructs a new, immutable extension reference that refers uniquely to the given extension name.

Parameters:
category - the category of the extension. Never null, but it can be an empty string
handlerName - The handler name. Must not be null and must be a valid handler name.
context - The context. Must not be null and must be a valid context.
extensionName - The extension name. Must not be null and must be a valid extension name.
See Also:
isValidExtensionName(java.lang.String), isValidContext(java.lang.String)

PSExtensionRef

public PSExtensionRef(String fullName)
Constructs a new PSExtensionRef from the given full ref, which is of the format returned by toString().

Parameters:
fullName - The full extension ref. Must not be null. throws IllegalArgumentException If any param is invalid.
Method Detail

handlerRef

public static PSExtensionRef handlerRef(String handlerName)
Factory method to create a new well-formed PSExtensionRef that refers to an extension handler with the given name.

Parameters:
handlerName - The extension handler name. Must not be null and must be a valid extension name.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If any param is invalid.

getHandlerName

public String getHandlerName()
Returns the name of the handler for this extension, which is unique within the server.

Returns:
The name of the extension handler. Never null.

getContext

public String getContext()
Returns the canonical context for this extension, which is a sequence of valid extension names separated by forward slashes. There will be a single trailing slash at the end of the context name, but no slash at the beginning of the name.

There are no semantic restrictions context names, there are only syntactic restrictions. This means that other server components can use a systematic context-naming system to impose a sub-structure or namespace on the extensions they install and use.

Returns:
The canonical context for this extension. Never null.

getCategory

public String getCategory()
Returns the category of this extension

Returns:
the category of this extension, never null, but it can be an empty string

getExtensionName

public String getExtensionName()
Returns the name of this extension, which is unique within its handler.

Returns:
The name of this extension. Never null.

Setter for the extension name field.

Parameters:
extName - extension name, must not be null or empty.

getFQN

public String getFQN()
Gets the canonical fully-qualified name (FQN) for this reference, by concatenating the handler name, context, and extension name.

fully-qualified name for this reference, never null or empty.

isValidContext

public static boolean isValidContext(String context)
Returns true if and only if the given String is a well-formed context. A well-formed context is defined as a sequence of valid extension names separated by forward slashes.

Parameters:
context - The context to check for validity. If null, false will be returned.
Returns:
true iff the given String is a well-formed context.

isValidContextName

public static boolean isValidContextName(String name)
Returns true if and only if the given String is a well-formed context name. Context name is more forgiving than an extension name, '-' characters are acceptable after the leading character.

Parameters:
name - The extension name to check for validity. If null, false will be returned.
Returns:
true iff the given String is a well-formed context name.

isValidExtensionName

public static boolean isValidExtensionName(String name)
Returns true if and only if the given String is a well-formed extension name.

Parameters:
name - The extension name to check for validity. If null, false will be returned.
Returns:
true iff the given String is a well-formed extension name.

canonicalizeContext

public static String canonicalizeContext(String context)
Returns the canonical version of this context.

Parameters:
context - A valid context name. Must not be null.
Returns:
A canonical version of this context.
See Also:
getContext()

getComparator

public static Comparator getComparator()
Returns an object that implements Comparator and is capable of comparing two PSExtensionRef objects.

Returns:
The Comparator. Never null, compares the two objects lexicographically, ignoring case.

isValidFullName

public static boolean isValidFullName(String fullName)
Checks for a valid extension's full Name. The extension full name is expected to be formed as handlerName/context/extensionName.

Parameters:
fullName - an extension's name to be checked for validity. Can be null
Returns:
true if the extension's name is a valid name otherwise false
